meanings.definition: Take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use)
meanings.sent1: The new manager will supersede the old one.
meanings.sent2: The updated software will supersede the outdated version.
meanings.sent3: The young prince joked that his pet frog would supersede him as king one day.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun seemed to supersede the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The unstoppable tide of technology will supersede traditional methods.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to supersede the old logo with a new design.
meanings.sent2: She will supersede her sister as the team captain.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made it seem like the rabbit would supersede the hat.
meanings.sent4: The fresh coat of paint seemed to supersede the scratches on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The young sapling will soon supersede the old tree in height.
